intro: Bauschia bracteolata, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its compact growth habit and ability to withstand harsh conditions make it well adapted to its native habitat. Bauschia bracteolata is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops where it contributes to local biodiversity.
